intro: Claytonia peirsonii, commonly known as the Sierra fairyshade, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the portulacaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, showy flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Claytonia peirsonii is adapted to cold climates and is typically in bloom during the spring and early summer.
